review_title: Where careers and dreams go to die.
pros: There are not many pros other than you will get to work with a very unique set of patients. As a provider you will be challenged medically and work with a lot of migrant farmworkers.
cons:
If I could give zero stars, I would. Clinica Sierra Vista was once a standing pillar in the central
valley providing health care to under-resourced communities; recently, it has fallen into
disarray and chaos. The organization is rampant with nepotism, favoritism, and sexual affairs
among leaders. A severe lack of transparency exists in hiring and promotion practices. Equity is not something that exists or is valued in the organization, as employees are not given a fair chance at opportunities for promotion. There have been several instances where executive leaders have been promoted based on loyalty and not competence. This happens at all levels of the organization. The organization is currently being led by Olga Meave, who used to be the CMO, and Oscar Fletes, the previous director of General Services, now the Chief Operating Officer. Both leaders lack the experience and the competencies required to create a healthy, thriving organization that values shared governance and employees. They have alienated other executive leaders and are relying on short-sighted unilateral decisions that dramatically and negatively impact the organization. Their poor decision-making and authoritarian leadership style lead to high attrition, dissatisfaction, and disengagement of employees at all levels of the organization. Most notably, long-time executives, leaders, and employees have either resigned or have been laid off under the pretense of budgetary constraints imbued by the toxic work culture they perpetuate and lead. Everyone fears they will be retaliated against for speaking up against poor decision-making and unethical practices. Leaders who dare speak out are pushed out of the organization. They have zero self-awareness and refuse to take any accountability for the negative impact that they have caused the organization. In their quest for power, they have destroyed many people’s livelihoods without thinking of the chaos left in their wake. They say they value the patient population, yet both lack the lived experiences and empathy to honestly care for the people served by the organization both internally and externally. They are wolves in sheep’s clothing.
Unfortunately, because they are willing to push out whoever disagrees with them, many people
fear speaking up. This has created a work environment where employees throw each other under the bus to protect their jobs, a classic symptom of toxic leadership. Clinica Sierra Vista is no longer an organization that values employees or patients. It’s Board of Directors, lacks leadership, understanding, and business acumen, which further compounds the behaviors of leaders like Olga Meave and Oscar Fletes. If you want to work at an organization that places blame on everyone else, this is the place for you. If you want to work for an organization that coerces its employees into submission, this is the place for you. If you want to work for an organization where you don’t know who you can trust, this is the place for you. If you want to work for an organization driven by self-fulfillment rather than improving the communities they serve, this is the place for you. If you want to work for an organization where you will be lied to this is the place for you. 

The reputation of this organization in the community is poor as it should be. The turnover rate
hovers around 28%+, which should tell you what you need to know. If you are considering accepting a job here, DON’T! They have recruited employees only to eliminate their roles shortly after they started and have misled many employees about what their roles would be. Save yourself the torture, do not come and work for this organization. There are plenty of other Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHC) in the central valley where you will be treated better. You have options, don’t settle for this mediocre place. The organization had so much potential; unfortunately, incompetent leaders have been promoted who care more about themselves. Olga and Oscar should be removed and replaced by competent leaders with ACTUAL experience!

job_title: Clinical Care Coordinator in Fresno, CA
pros: -Good place to start because people are always quiting. Good opportunity to learn by yourself.
cons:
-pay -- you will do double the work and get paid very little. Fast food restuarants get the same amount of pay. Everyone gets bombarded with work everyday. 
-benefits -- you will be thrown into the pool with other patients (No special treatment) You will have to compete with thousands of patients to be seen or heard.
-medical staff is disorganized & lazy -- Doesn't follow up with patients.
-Not enough work supplies: Only 1 fax machine for 3 departments, laminating machine doesn't work, and cheap ink pens. If you forget your ID badge, they won't give you a spare. 
-Training -- People are always quiting, not enough seniors training new employees.
-HR doesn't listen to employees -- Practice managers don't care for providers or medical staff. Management doesn't care about staff, all about the money.

cons: The company is on a continual path of improvement, so if you don't like change this is not the place for you. Work here is fast-paced, patient-centered, and compassion-focused, so be prepared to work hard.

review_title: Dislike the politics of Senior Leaders who only cares about business aspect of CSV, not the employee satisfaction.
pros: Being able to provide patient care as needed within my scope of practice.  The providers I work with are productive and meets their numbers of seeing patients as predicted from upper management.
cons:
Oh boy, where do I begin...lack of resource support, lack of management support because they have to wait on their upper management for guidance, inexperienced Practice Managers with no credible management medical backgrounds and if they do, they lack front office management background.  Staff always calling out and is still there working without being reprimanded because they are either safe from having a Dr's note to cover themselves.  Lack of management communication.  Lack of Nurses leads communication.   Feels like I'm working in a "High School" setting.  It's who you know and you can bully other staff to either take a LOA or quit altogether.  
Looks like upper management made poor choices and is pushing nursing staff to work as a 1:1 with a provider and expectations are set high.  Upper management don't care until someone resigns and then they'll do something to put a temporary fix.  
Some good providers and some bad providers,  overall, if you enjoy surprises to be working on a skeleton crew, then come on over and join the CSV nursing team.
